I know this almost goes without saying, but any gamer alive should play the Half-Life games. Even compared with the modern flashy big-budget single-player shooter extravaganzas of today (I'm looking at you, Far Cry and Bioshock), which are rightly heralded as amazing games, Half-Life makes your jaw drop at how amazing of an experience it is to fight throuth the crumbling Black Mesa facility battling humans and headcrabs alike. This game really makes you realize how much Jason Brody, Booker Dewitt, and every other major fps protagonist since owe the man with the crowbar, Gordon Freeman. If you are a sane human being who can play a video game, there is no excuse for you to not play Half-Life. None!

[h1]Do [b]NOT[/b] buy this version of the game![/h1]

Half-Life is an excellent game and a definite must-have in your Steam library. But do [b]NOT[/b] play [b]this version[/b] of the game. [b]Especially[/b] if this is your first time playing Half-Life. Please go and buy [i]Half-Life[/i] and not this piece of shit version ([i]Half-Life: Source[/i]). I could also forgive you if you play Black Mesa for the first time. That too is a much better option than this. You won't play this game unless you're a die-hard HL fan. And you'll still regret it no doubt.

The game is a bugged mess, the autosaves don't work 70% of the time and this game isn't even [i]remastered[/i] in any way! It's just been ported to Source! The only thing you do have are HD models for your guns which turns your MP5 texture into an M4/Colt 727. That is the only thing different in terms of visuals from the original Half-Life. Please, do yourself a favor and [b]play the original instead[/b].

Edit: The (worse) HD models can also be found in the original Half-Life so Half-Life: Source doesn't even offer that.

[strike]1.5/10[/strike]
1/10

Pros:
- Shaders, melhorias a luz
- Efeitos de partícula
- Água realista
- Skybox 3D
- Bugs/glitches ocasionalmente engraçados
Contras:
- Horrívelmente quebrado desde 2013, nada será consertado pela VALVe porque o jogo não teve uma boa recepção e eles não veem por que atualizá-lo.
- Bugs estragam a experiência (Exemplo: Helicóptero indestrutível em Surface Tension. A única arma que causa dano a ele é um RPG, que você não tem a esse ponto do jogo)
- Mesmo preço que Half-Life 1, te dando 0 motivos para não comprar o original em vez desse
Many bugs and weird glitches, I don't recommend you buy this. Instead, buy the original Half-Life or Black Mesa.

the game was really buggy. Barnacles often didn't function properly, the smg shook like the player had arms of paper, A lot of the scripted events don't work, and the AI itself was inherently broken. It is barely playable sometimes, and just not worth it. if your looking for the authentic experience you should probably find the original game

while technically still a good game experience, there's not much more that HL:S has to offer compared to the original. Besides some superficial aspects like improved source lighting, physics, different menus, etc. it has an abundance of weird bugs that put a damper on the experience while not really changing much else to compensate. The old models and textures will now simply react to the physics world of the source engine at the cost of longer load times that interrupt and end the awesome music that often plays between chapters (the end of "We've Got Hostiles" is particularly upsetting); you might as well play half life levels in garry's mod.

This game is a pure classic that everybody should play. Source ver.is very nice graphics and upgreated weaponry-look, I think it is not a sin to skip oryginal HL to play this ver. However this game is so good, that it would be also nice to walkthrough oryginal HL with poor old school graphics, also with Blueshift and Opposing Force - and then do HL source.

If you love messing with the source engine, or love Garry's Mod, buy it.
Otherwise, don't touch it.

Oh, and if you're photosensitive, [b][u]DO NOT BUY THIS![u][b]

This review is for the Source version only. I like the original Half-life and do recommend to buy it. I do NOT recommend buying a Source version over it, especially if you did not play the original version first.

So - if you did not play an original Half-life and choose between original and Source versions - pick original without hesitation.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/70/HalfLife

What's better in HL:Source:

* Much better physics engine.  Physics in Half-life is very primitive, sometimes it makes gameplay a bit cumbersome (think of puzzles with moving crates). BUT since levels were not designed with physics in mind - you get out of it almost nothing. Grenades fly a bit better, dead bodies can make strange shapes on the floor, that is it.
* A bit better graphics. Lighting in Source is very good.

What makes me to recommend original HL over it? 
Bugs, of course. These bugs do not make this game unplayable, but experience is much worse. Especially since some of those bugs are in key moments of the game. Tentacles in rocket engine lab and helicopters with broken hitbox.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2158788132
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2157220094

Also barnacles sometimes do not touch ground with their tongs 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2159268986

And vortigaunts accumulating energy can not be killed.
And some more 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2159107696 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2157218401 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2157214275

So. If you already played an original - go for it. If it's your first experience - I do not recommend starting with this one.

On surface level, It's just a graphically improved version of the original Half Life game from 1998, on the new(er) Source engine. But reality is that it's just a buggier version of the original. The most valid reason I could think of buying it is if you want to use it for Garry's Mod. Below that is the ragdoll deaths if you're a scientist-killing lunatic like me :). But on it's own, it barley offers any new content. If you like the HD models from the HL:S, then the best thing to do is to turn on HD models in the video settings of the Original 98' game, because it seems like it's literally the same thing. But at least its nice to see that there's more Half-Life content for me to consume, even if was little to nothing. To be honest, if the Half-Life series took a fat dump, I wouldn't hesitate to eat it all up.

Please note that I did not play the original port (yet) so this is me going in blind in terms of look and feel of the game. 

If I had the option of picking a neutral stance on this game I would. I'd rate this a 5/10 -- not incredible, but certainly not garbage. The story was great, the action was interesting and challenging (especially since I played on Hard mode) and the changing environments help out immerse yourself in the world. I like the concept of the suit being the reason Gordon survives all the shit that's thrown at him and I really like the idea of an alien invasion. I loved the buddy system of having a scientist or police guard follow you through the levels, even though I always got mine killed on accident.

Though, I do have some gripes with the game. (Again, this might be because I played HL:S, not the original. Maybe the original has these issues fixed, which would be counterintuitive, but who knows. I have been told that the original with a certain mod makes it a whole lot better, so that might just be what I need to do.)

For one, I counted three times where I managed to softlock myself. I don't remember exactly where, but it happened. As a first-time player, this was a bit worrying. I shouldn't have been able to softlock myself to the point where I had to enable noclip just to get back to where I was, and the first time this happened it was because I didn't know where to go and took a path where I thought would take me further in the level when it simply... didn't. There were also a lot of bugs here and there that kind of ruined the immersion. Installing the HD pack simply deleted all the sounds for your primary weapon for some reason? A silenced shotgun completely took me out of the game. Also, the autosave feature, while nice, really threw me for a loop if i ended up being in a loading zone with no health. In most cases, the enemies would kill me instantly. There was even a point where I tried to rush through a level only to die right past a loading zone, meaning that I had enemies on both sides of me while I had 10hp left. Keep in mind that this was in the beginning chapters, where I shouldn't be struggling so much. I was essentially forced to quicksave on my own every time I could catch a breath so I don't get stuck like that. Also, the music wasn't good, but that's more of a personal thing.

Nevertheless, considering how old this game (at least the original) and how monumental it is for Valve and video games in general, especially with Source, I can see why this game was considered amazing. It's not my cup of tea, but I'll attribute the issues I have with it more to the game's age and port, especially considering that I think HL:S was simply a re-skin of the original. I'm going to keep playing through the HL franchise and see how much improves with each installment. After all, I got the Half Life pack, so I might as well play everything :) . I heard HL2 is miles better so we'll see!
